div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, April 18, 1942
div1.opener:
April 18, 1942
Mr. P. M. Hamer
Director of Reference Service
National Archives
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Hamer:
div1.p:
Enclosed please find check for $5.00 for which
please send me photostatic copies of the data mentioned in
your letter of April 1, 1942 and some additional data noted
below:

Data from Register of Medical Officers:
Walter Reed: 1875-1878, 1879-1885,
1886-1890, 1891-1893; 1894-1897.

I am also very anxious to get the record of
Godfrey from 1903 inclusive to the time of his death. You
did not mention this in your letter. I have his record as
given on pp. 460, 463 and 533 of Vol. 11, Register of Medical
Officers but apparently page 461 was not photostated for me
in my previous order and I do not have his record after
Dec. 31, 1902 (p 533). Please send me p. 461 and whatever
you find about him between Dec. 31, 1902 and his death. If
my check isn't sufficient I will send more.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
